This is a mixed environment where you can have normal text and c=±a2+b2c = \pm\sqrt{a^2 + b^2}c=±a2+b2​ fenced math.$!

Matrix Basics (?)

An n×mn\times mn×m matrix has nnn rows and mmm columns. Multiplying m×k][k×n]=[m×k].m\times k] [k \times n]=[m\times k].m×k][k×n]=[m×k]. For C=ABC=ABC=AB we have (Cij)=(ith row of A)⋅(jth column of B).(C_ij)=(i\text{th row of } A)\cdot (j\text{th column of B}).(Ci​j)=(ith row of A)⋅(jth column of B).

The magnitude of a vector can be found by dotting it with itself then taking the square root.

The transpose of a matrix, MTM^TMT, is constructed be switching values across the main diagonal:

A=[abcd]  ⟹  AT=[acbd].A=\begin{bmatrix}a&b\\c&d\end{bmatrix}\implies A^T = \begin{bmatrix} a & c \\ b & d \end{bmatrix}.A=[ac​bd​]⟹AT=[ab​cd​].

Properties:

  • (AB)T=BTAT(AB)^T=B^TA^T(AB)T=BTAT
  • (AB)C=A(BC)=ABC(AB)C = A(BC) = ABC(AB)C=A(BC)=ABC
  • AB≠BAAB\neq BAAB​=BA (not necessary at least)

An n×nn\times nn×n matrix is orthogonal if

MTM=I=[1…0⋮⋱⋮0…1]=(δij)M^TM=I=\begin{bmatrix}1&\dots&0\\\vdots&\ddots&\vdots\\0&\dots&1\end{bmatrix}=(\delta_{ij})MTM=I=⎣⎢⎢⎡​1⋮0​…⋱…​0⋮1​⎦⎥⎥⎤​=(δij​)

where δij=1\delta_{ij}=1δij​=1 for i=ji=ji=j and 0 otherwise.

(less mathematically rigorous but intuitively better: orthogonal matrices have columns with length one, so when an orthogonal matrix is used as a transformation it preserves length)

For v⃗∈Rn≠0⃗\vec{v}\in \mathbb{R}^n \neq \vec{0}v∈Rn​=0 if Av⃗=λv⃗A\vec{v}=\lambda\vec{v}Av=λv then λ\lambdaλ is an eigenvalue of AAA and v⃗\vec{v}v is its corresponding eigenvector.

We can find eigenvalues as the roots of the characteristic polynomial, which is the determinant of A−λI.A-\lambda I.A−λI.

Symmetric (symmetric means that A=ATA=A^TA=AT) matrices must have at least one eigenvalue.

For every symmetric matrix there is an orthonormal eigenbasis.

c=±a2+b2 c = \pm\sqrt{a^2 + b^2} c=±a2+b2​
